isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER DIAGNOSTICS AND SERVICE - REMOVE AND INSTALL - 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, 8000 MODELS

svcsubproc.title: January 1989 to March 1992 - Instrument Cluster, Remove

caution.para: Static electricity can cause permanent damage to the cluster. Before working on the cluster, be sure to remove all static electricity from your body by touching metal that is grounded. Do not wear clothing that causes static electric build up (nylon).

note.para:
Before replacing a speedometer/tachometer gauge cluster, refer to CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS
to verify cluster needs replacing.

step1.para: Always place the ignition in the OFF position (not ACC) prior to working on the cluster, due to potential shorting between the ground and ignition pins, which will damage the circuit board and gauges.
Protect the bezel during removal by placing a soft cloth on the forward side of the steering column.
Remove the four cluster mounting screws ( Figure 1).

figure.caption: 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, 8000 Models Instrument Cluster Bezel, January 1989 to March 1992

step1.para: Tilt or lift out cluster assembly from instrument panel.
Disconnect the three wiring harness connectors from the back of the cluster assembly ( Figure 1).
Disconnect the fitting on the back of the oil pressure gauge ( Figure 2). The oil gauge elbow must be held with a wrench while disconnecting the oil line.

figure.caption: 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, 8000 Models Air or Oil Gauge Fittings and Lines, January 1989 to March 1992

caution.para: When disconnecting or tightening air pressure and oil pressure line fittings, be sure to use two wrenches. One wrench must be on the gauge elbow to prevent it from turning.

step1.para: After bleeding the air system, disconnect the air lines from the fittings on the back of the air gauges ( Figure 2). Two air pressure gauges are used on vehicles with air brakes. The air gauge elbow must be held while disconnecting the air line.

caution.para: Note the color of the air lines. The green line is for the primary system and the orange line is for the secondary system.

step1.para: Disconnect the fuel-tach connections if the vehicle is so equipped.
The instrument cluster assembly is now free to be removed from the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: January 1989 to March 1992 - Instrument Cluster, Install

caution.para: Static electricity can cause permanent damage to the cluster. Before working on the cluster, be sure to remove all static electricity from your body by touching metal that is grounded. Do not wear clothing that causes static electric build up (nylon).
When disconnecting or tightening air pressure and oil pressure line fittings, be sure to use two wrenches. One wrench must be on the gauge elbow to prevent it from turning.
Note the color of the air lines. The green line is for the primary system and the orange line is for the secondary system.

step1.para: Protect the instrument cluster bezel during installation by placing a soft cloth on the forward side of the steering column.
Place the instrument cluster by the instrument panel opening.
Connect and tighten the fuel-tach fittings if so equipped.

Connect and tighten the air line fittings to the back of the air gauges. Be sure to observe air line color coding. The air gauge elbow must be held with a wrench while tightening the air line fitting to prevent it from turning.

Connect and tighten the oil pressure line to the fitting on the back of the oil pressure gauge ( Figure 2). The oil gauge elbow must be held with a wrench while tightening the oil line fitting to prevent it from turning.
Connect the three wiring harness connectors to the back of the cluster assembly ( Figure 1).
Position the cluster assembly into the instrument panel opening.
Install and tighten the (4) four cluster mounting screws ( Figure 1).

svcsubproc.title: January 1989 to March 1992 - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Remove
svcsubproc.para: It is recommended that the entire cluster be removed from the instrument panel to perform gauge removal and/or installation. This provides more work room and minimizes the risk of damaging the cluster or the instruments.

step1.para: Place the instrument cluster face up on a clean, horizontal surface to prevent loss of unused gauge covers, gauges, etc. Remove the center cluster screw that retains the bezel to the cluster housing.
Remove the bezel assembly from the housing and put it in a safe place to prevent scratching. Take care not to damage the gauge pointers when removing the bezel.
The speedo/tach gauges are plug-in type gauges. To remove, grasp the edge of the gauge and pull straight out.

caution.para: After a gauge is removed from the cluster, it is important that the exposed pin terminals attached to the circuit board are not touched or shorted across. Static electricity or shorting between power and ground terminals can damage the cluster.
When removing or installing the hourmeter or odometer, do not touch the metal portion of the leads that fasten to the circuit board. A static discharge could damage the cluster.
Individual gauge dials are not protected by a lens. When removing or installing gauges, handle them by the edge of the dial face only. Do not touch the gauge pointer.

svcsubproc.title: January 1989 to March 1992 - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Install

caution.para: After a gauge is removed from the cluster, it is important that the exposed pin terminals attached to the circuit board are not touched or shorted across. Static electricity or shorting between power and ground terminals can damage the cluster.
When removing or installing the hourmeter or odometer, do not touch the metal portion of the leads that fasten to the circuit board. A static discharge could damage the cluster.
Individual gauge dials are not protected by a lens. When removing or installing gauges, handle them by the edge of the dial face only. Do not touch the gauge pointer.

svcsubproc.para: It is recommended that the entire cluster be removed from the instrument panel to perform gauge removal and/or installation. This provides more work room and minimizes the risk of damaging the cluster or the instruments.

step1.para: The speedo/tach gauges are plug-in type gauges. To install, grasp the edge of the gauge and align the gauge pins with the pin terminals on the circuit board and push straight in.
Position and align the bezel assembly to the cluster housing.
Install the center cluster screw that retains the bezel to the cluster housing.

svcsubproc.title: March 1992 and Later - Instrument Cluster, Remove

caution.para: Static electricity can cause permanent damage to the cluster. Before working on the cluster, be sure to remove all static electricity from your body by touching metal that is grounded. Do not wear clothing that causes static electric build up (nylon).

note.para:
Before replacing a speedometer/tachometer gauge cluster, refer to CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS
to verify cluster needs replacing.

step1.para: Always place the ignition in the OFF position (not ACC) prior to working on the cluster, due to potential shorting between the ground and ignition pins, which will damage the circuit board and gauges.
Protect the bezel during removal by placing a soft cloth on the forward side of the steering column.
Remove the two cluster mounting screws located on the lower front face of the cluster ( Figure 3).

figure.caption: 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, 8000 Models Instrument Cluster Bezel, March 1992 and Later

step1.para: Depress the two gray retaining tabs located on the top corners of the bezel ( Figure 3, Item 6).

Holding the tabs depressed, pull the cluster forward and gently release it from the frame. If the cluster does not come loose easily, put more pressure on the tabs and continue to pull gently. Do not attempt to pry the cluster from the frame as damage will result.
Disconnect the three wiring harness connectors from the back of the cluster assembly ( Figure 3).
Disconnect the oil line fitting on the back of the oil pressure gauge ( Figure 4). The oil gauge elbow must be held with a wrench while disconnecting the oil line to prevent it from turning.

figure.caption: 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, 8000 Models Oil Gauge Fitting and Line, March 1992 and Later

caution.para: When disconnecting or tightening oil pressure line fittings, be sure to use two wrenches. One wrench must be on the gauge elbow to prevent it from turning.

step1.para: After bleeding the air system, disconnect the air line fittings from the back of the air gauge. A double needle air pressure gauge is used on vehicles with air brakes ( Figure 5).

figure.caption: 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, 8000 Models Air Line Fittings, March 1992 and Later

caution.para: Note the color of the air gauge air lines. The green line is for the primary system and the orange line is for the secondary system.

step1.para: The instrument cluster assembly is now free to be removed from the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: March 1992 and Later - Instrument Cluster, Install

caution.para: Static electricity can cause permanent damage to the cluster. Before working on the cluster, be sure to remove all static electricity from your body by touching metal that is grounded. Do not wear clothing that causes static electric build up (nylon).
When disconnecting or tightening oil pressure line fittings, be sure to use two wrenches. One wrench must be on the gauge elbow to prevent it from turning.
Note the color of the air gauge air lines. The green line is for the primary system and the orange line is for the secondary system.

step1.para: Protect the instrument cluster bezel during installation by placing a soft cloth on the forward side of the steering column.
Place the instrument cluster by the instrument panel opening.
Connect and tighten the air line fittings to the back of the air gauges. Be sure to observe air line color coding.

Connect and tighten the oil pressure line to the fitting on the back of the oil pressure gauge. The oil gauge elbow must be held with a wrench while tightening the oil line fitting to prevent it from turning.

note.para: Do not exceed 36 in-lbs. (4.0 Nm) of torque when tightening the air and oil lines.

step1.para: Connect the three wiring harness connectors to the back of the cluster. These connectors are color-coded for proper orientation.
Align the cluster in the instrument panel frame and push the cluster gently until the retaining tabs snap into place.
Install the two cluster mounting screws on the lower front face of the cluster.

svcsubproc.title: March 1992 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Remove
svcsubproc.para: It is recommended that the entire cluster be removed from the instrument panel to perform gauge removal and/or installation. This provides more work room and minimizes the risk of damaging the cluster or the instruments.

step1.para: Remove the three bezel screws that fasten the bezel to the cluster housing ( Figure 6). Place the instrument cluster face up on a clean, horizontal surface to prevent loss of unused gauge covers, gauges, etc.

figure.caption: 1000, 2000, 3000, 4000, 8000 Models Instrument Cluster Housing, March 1992 and Later

step1.para: Remove the bezel lens assembly from the housing and put it in a safe place to prevent scratching. Take care not to damage the gauge pointers with the bezel or lens.

caution.para: Individual gauge dials are not protected by a lens. When removing or installing gauges handle them by the edge of the dial face only. Do not touch the gauge pointer.

step1.para: The speedo/tach gauges are plug-in type gauges. To remove, locate the hole in the back of the cluster behind the gauge and using a small, blunt tool such as a small screwdriver handle, push the gauge out of the housing. Once the gauge has cleared the retaining snaps, it may be removed from the front.

caution.para: After a gauge is removed from the cluster, it is important that the exposed pin terminals attached to the circuit board are not touched or shorted across. Static electricity or shorting between power and ground terminals can damage the cluster.

step1.para: To remove the hourmeter and/or odometer, disconnect the wiring plugs from the circuit board at the back of the cluster. At the front of the cluster, remove the adhesive-backed mask covering the gauge, then retract the two fingers that hold the gauges in the cluster and lift the gauge out of the cluster.

caution.para: When removing or installing the hourmeter or odometer, do not touch the metal portion of the leads that fasten to the circuit board. A static discharge could damage the cluster.

svcsubproc.title: March 1992 and Later - Speedometer/Tachometer Gauges, Install

caution.para: Individual gauge dials are not protected by a lens. When removing or installing gauges handle them by the edge of the dial face only. Do not touch the gauge pointer.

After a gauge is removed from the cluster, it is important that the exposed pin terminals attached to the circuit board are not touched or shorted across. Static electricity or shorting between power and ground terminals can damage the cluster.
When removing or installing the hourmeter or odometer, do not touch the metal portion of the leads that fasten to the circuit board. A static discharge could damage the cluster.

step1.para: To install the hourmeter and/or odometer, route the wiring plug through the appropriate cluster opening and through the circuit panel. Position the gauge in the opening and push down until the retaining tabs snap into place. Align the adhesive-backed mask to the gauge opening and press into place. Plug the wiring connector into the circuit board terminal.

The speedo/tach gauges are plug-in type gauges. To install, grasp the gauge by the edge of the dial face. Align the gauge pins with the pin terminals on the circuit board and push straight in until the retaining tabs snap into place.
Assemble the bezel and lens to the cluster assembly and install three screws that attach the bezel to the cluster housing.
